ray.rage.rendersystem.states

Enum TextureState.WrapMode

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<TextureState.WrapMode>
      • ray.rage.rendersystem.states.TextureState.WrapMode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<TextureState.WrapMode>
    Enclosing interface:
    TextureState

    public static enum TextureState.WrapMode
extends java.lang.Enum<TextureState.WrapMode>
    The wrap mode is a function that determines how texture coordinates will be used to map texels to pixels.
    Author:
    Raymond L. Rivera

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      CLAMP_TO_BORDER
      Behaves like CLAMP_TO_EDGE, except in cases where clamping would have occurred if CLAMP_TO_EDGE had been in use.
      CLAMP_TO_EDGE
      Clamps the texture coordinate gets to the range [1/2N, 1 - 1/2N], where N is the size of the texture in the direction of clamping.
      CLAMP_TO_EDGE_MIRRORED
      Causes the the coordinate to be repeated as in , but only for one repetition of the texture, after which point the coordinate is to be clamped as in CLAMP_TO_EDGE.
      REPEAT
      Ignores the integer part of the texture coordinate; uses only the fractional part, thereby creating a repeating pattern.
      REPEAT_MIRRORED
      Causes the texture coordinate to be set to the fractional part if the integer part of coordinate is an even number.

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • REPEAT

        public static final TextureState.WrapMode REPEAT
        Ignores the integer part of the texture coordinate; uses only the fractional part, thereby creating a repeating pattern.

      • REPEAT_MIRRORED

        public static final TextureState.WrapMode REPEAT_MIRRORED
        Causes the texture coordinate to be set to the fractional part if the integer part of coordinate is an even number. If the integer part of coordinate is odd, then the texture coordinate is set to 1 - fractionalPart.

      • CLAMP_TO_EDGE

        public static final TextureState.WrapMode CLAMP_TO_EDGE
        Clamps the texture coordinate gets to the range [1/2N, 1 - 1/2N], where N is the size of the texture in the direction of clamping.

      • CLAMP_TO_EDGE_MIRRORED

        public static final TextureState.WrapMode CLAMP_TO_EDGE_MIRRORED
        Causes the the coordinate to be repeated as in , but only for one repetition of the texture, after which point the coordinate is to be clamped as in CLAMP_TO_EDGE.

      • CLAMP_TO_BORDER

        public static final TextureState.WrapMode CLAMP_TO_BORDER
        Behaves like CLAMP_TO_EDGE, except in cases where clamping would have occurred if CLAMP_TO_EDGE had been in use. In this case, the fetched texel data is replaced by values specified for the texture's border.

        Note that this does not happen automatically. At this time, there's no support for specifying what the RenderSystem should use as border colors.

    System.out.println(c);
